alert.note: Alert for Choctaw; Clarke; Washington (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 20 at 9:48AM CST until February 25 at 10:48AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Alabama... Tombigbee River Near Coffeeville Dam affecting Choctaw, Washington and Clarke Counties. For the Tombigbee River...including Coffeeville Dam, Leroy...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Tombigbee River Near Coffeeville Dam. * WHEN...Until Saturday morning. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Monday the stage was 34.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 AM CST Monday was 34.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 34.8 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued when updates occur.
